short_summary: Fisheries and Oceans Canada's Salmonid Enhancement Program (SEP) delivers the Community Involvement Program (CIP) with the intent of providing technical support to salmon enhancement projects and habitat enhancement /restoration projects undertaken by local community groups and volunteers. SEP also delivers a formal education program – known as the Stream to Sea Program. The intent of the program is to encourage students from Kindergarten to Grade 12, as well as First Nations, local communities and external parties to participate in cooperative fisheries and watershed stewardship activities.
description: The Salmonid Enhancement Program (SEP) aims to enhance salmon populations in British Columbia through various measures. The Community Involvement Program (CIP) is a key component of SEP, which fosters community participation in salmon enhancement and habitat restoration projects. The program provides technical support, education, and community outreach to local community groups and volunteers. Requirements for the contract include providing bio-technical support to CIP projects and community groups, conducting research and monitoring, and supporting education and outreach activities. Expertise in fish production, riparian planting and management, and environmental monitoring is required. The successful contractor will work closely with the Department of Fisheries and Oceans to deliver the program and ensure its success. The contract is for a duration of one year, with the option to renew annually.
